message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this incredible opportunity to acquire a unique product that I believe will bring you significant value. I'm willing to sell it to you for $1500000.

Alice, I appreciate your offer, but $1500000 is a bit more than I'm comfortable with right now.  I'm willing to pay $800000 for the product. This is my maximum budget, so I'm hoping we can come to an agreement.

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand that $800000 is your maximum budget, but I'm afraid I need to make a profit on this deal. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'm counteroffering at $1200000. This is my lowest price, and I'm confident it's a fair offer considering the product's value.
Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $1200000 is still outside my budget.  I'm sticking to my initial offer of $800000. It's my final offer, and I'm hoping you'll reconsider.

I understand that you're firm on your budget, Bob, but I'm still not willing to sell the product for $800000. I'm willing to compromise, but I need to make a significant profit. I'm counteroffering at $1100000. This is my next best offer, and I'm hoping you'll consider it.

Alice, while I appreciate your efforts, $1100000 is still too high for me. I'm not comfortable going above my initial offer of $800000.  This is my final offer, and I'm hoping you'll reconsider. If not, I'll have to explore other options.

I understand that you're firm on your budget, Bob, but I'm not willing to sell the product for $800000. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to make a minimum of $1100000 to make this deal worthwhile. I'm counteroffering at $1050000. This is my last offer, and I'm hoping you'll consider it.
